page.title: 04GREENMILE FARM, RANBY
page.content: Situated in the south-east quadrant of the block (664,819) this farm illustrates one system by which farmers have adapted to constantly changing conditions. The farm is of approximately 700 acres and employs 17 staff. The principal crops are barley, wheat, peas and sugar beet. To combat the lack of fertility the farmer keeps over 3000 pigs, of which the manure is ploughed back into the soil. Large quantities of soft fruit are grown which occupies most of the workforce. Much of the field work is now done by machine for which a full time mechanic is employed. Several acres are used for growing trees which are used to create windbreaks and are sold to local authorities for parks and gardens.
